alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 6:38AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated rain was decreasing in coverage. However small stream flooding is likely ongoing. Between 0.75 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redwood City, Palo Alto, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Menlo Park, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Scotts Valley, Half Moon Bay, Capitola, Live Oak, Los Altos Hills, Atherton, Woodside, Boulder Creek, Ben Lomond, Felton, Twin Lakes, Soquel and Opal Cliffs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
